instructions.name: ADC - Add with Carry
instructions.description: Add the value at the specified memory address to the accumulator + the carry bit. On overflow, the carry bit is set.

instructions.name: AND - Bitwise AND
instructions.description: Perform an AND operation between the accumulator and the value at the specified memory address.

instructions.name: ASL - Arithmetic Shift Left
instructions.description: Shifts all the bits of the accumulator (or the byte at the specified memory address) by 1 bit to the left. Bit 0 will be set to 0 and the carry flag (C) will take the value of bit 7 (before the shift).

instructions.name: BCC - Branch if Carry Clear
instructions.description: If the carry flag (C) is clear, jumps to the specified location.

instructions.name: BCS - Branch if Carry Set
instructions.description: If the carry flag (C) is set, jumps to the specified location.

instructions.name: BEQ - Branch if Equal
instructions.description: If the zero flag (Z) is set, jumps to the specified location.

instructions.name: BIT - Bit Test
instructions.description: Bits 6 and 7 of the byte at the specified memory address are copied to the negative (N) and overflow (V) flags. If the accumulator's value ANDed with that byte is 0, the zero flag (Z) is set (otherwise it is cleared).

instructions.name: BMI - Branch if Minus
instructions.description: If the negative flag (N) is set, jumps to the specified location.

instructions.name: BNE - Branch if Not Equal
instructions.description: If the zero flag (Z) is clear, jumps to the specified location.

instructions.name: BPL - Branch if Positive
instructions.description: If the negative flag (N) is clear, jumps to the specified location.

instructions.name: BRK - Break
instructions.description: The BRK instruction causes the CPU to jump to its IRQ vector, as if an interrupt had occurred. The PC and status flags are pushed on the stack.

instructions.name: BVC - Branch if Overflow Clear
instructions.description: If the overflow flag (V) is clear, jumps to the specified location.

instructions.name: BVS - Branch if Overflow Set
instructions.description: If the overflow flag (V) is set then, jumps to the specified location.

instructions.name: CLC - Clear carry flag (C)
instructions.description: Clears the carry flag (C).

instructions.name: CLD - Clear Decimal Mode
instructions.description: Clears the decimal mode flag (D).

instructions.name: CLI - Clear Interrupt Disable
instructions.description: Clears the interrupt disable flag (I).

instructions.name: CLV - Clear overflow flag (V)
instructions.description: Clears the overflow flag (V).

instructions.name: CMP - Compare
instructions.description: Compares the accumulator with the byte at the specified memory address.

instructions.name: CPX - Compare X Register
instructions.description: Compares the X register with the byte at the specified memory address.

instructions.name: CPY - Compare Y Register
instructions.description: Compares the Y register with the byte at the specified memory address.

instructions.name: DEC - Decrement Memory
instructions.description: Subtracts one from the byte at the specified memory address.

instructions.name: DEX - Decrement X Register
instructions.description: Subtracts one from the X register.

instructions.name: DEY - Decrement Y Register
instructions.description: Subtracts one from the Y register.

instructions.name: EOR - Exclusive OR
instructions.description: Performs an exclusive OR operation between the accumulator and the byte at the specified memory address.

instructions.name: INC - Increment Memory
instructions.description: Adds one to the byte at the specified memory address.

instructions.name: INX - Increment X Register
instructions.description: Adds one to the X register.

instructions.name: INY - Increment Y Register
instructions.description: Adds one to the Y register.

instructions.name: JMP - Jump
instructions.description: Jumps to the specified location (alters the program counter)

instructions.name: JSR - Jump to Subroutine
instructions.description: Pushes the address (minus one) of the next instruction to the stack and then jumps to the target address.

instructions.name: LDA - Load Accumulator
instructions.description: Loads a byte from the specified memory address into the accumulator.

instructions.name: LDX - Load X Register
instructions.description: Loads a byte from the specified memory address into the X register.

instructions.name: LDY - Load Y Register
instructions.description: Loads a byte from the specified memory address into the Y register.

instructions.name: LSR - Logical Shift Right
instructions.description: Shifts all the bits of the accumulator (or the byte at the specified memory address) by 1 bit to the right. Bit 7 will be set to 0 and the carry flag (C) will take the value of bit 0 (before the shift).

instructions.name: NOP - No Operation
instructions.description: Performs no operation other than delaying execution of the next instruction by 2 cycles.

instructions.name: ORA - Inclusive OR
instructions.description: Performs an inclusive OR operation between the accumulator and the byte at the specified memory address.

instructions.name: PHA - Push Accumulator
instructions.description: Pushes the value of the accumulator to the stack.

instructions.name: PHP - Push Processor Status
instructions.description: Pushes the value of the status flags to the stack.

instructions.name: PLA - Pull Accumulator
instructions.description: Pulls a byte from the stack and stores it into the accumulator.

instructions.name: PLP - Pull Processor Status
instructions.description: Pulls a byte from the stack and stores it into the processor flags.  The flags will be modified based on the value pulled.

instructions.name: ROL - Rotate Left
instructions.description: Shifts all bits 1 position to the left. The right-most bit takes the current value of the carry flag (C). The left-most bit is stored into the carry flag (C).

instructions.name: ROR - Rotate Right
instructions.description: Shifts all bits 1 position to the right. The left-most bit takes the current value of the carry flag (C). The right-most bit is stored into the carry flag (C).

instructions.name: RTI - Return from Interrupt
instructions.description: The RTI instruction is used at the end of the interrupt handler to return execution to its original location.  It pulls the status flags and program counter from the stack.

instructions.name: RTS - Return from Subroutine
instructions.description: The RTS instruction is used at the end of a subroutine to return execution to the calling function. It pulls the status flags and program counter (minus 1) from the stack.

instructions.name: SBC - Subtract with Carry
instructions.description: Subtracts the byte at the specified memory address from the value of the accumulator (affected by the carry flag (C)).

instructions.name: SEC - Set carry flag (C)
instructions.description: Sets the carry flag (C).

instructions.name: SED - Set Decimal Flag
instructions.description: Sets the decimal mode flag (D).

instructions.name: SEI - Set Interrupt Disable
instructions.description: Sets the interrupt disable flag (I).

instructions.name: STA - Store Accumulator
instructions.description: Stores the value of the accumulator into memory.

instructions.name: STX - Store X Register
instructions.description: Stores the value of the X register into memory.

instructions.name: STY - Store Y Register
instructions.description: Stores the value of the Y register into memory.

instructions.name: TAX - Transfer A to X
instructions.description: Copies the accumulator into the X register.

instructions.name: TAY - Transfer A to Y
instructions.description: Copies the accumulator into the Y register.

instructions.name: TSX - Transfer SP to X
instructions.description: Copies the stack pointer into the X register.

instructions.name: TXA - Transfer X to A
instructions.description: Copies the X register into the accumulator.

instructions.name: TXS - Transfer X to SP
instructions.description: Copies the X register into the stack pointer.

instructions.name: TYA - Transfer Y to A
instructions.description: Copies the Y register into the accumulator.
